value.title: Maine May Limit Use of Facial Recognition Tech by Police
value.excerpt: Portland, would allow for the use of the digital technology in the investigation of only the most serious crimes, including rape and murder.

value.title: Mumbai: Railway cops to have a facial recognition app to identify criminals
value.excerpt: The Government Railway Police (GRP) is on the verge of developing an in house software to identify criminal with the previous criminal records. The software would have a facial recognition system which will enable the police to go through previous criminal history of a person with just a click.

value.title: One year after Amazon, Microsoft and IBM ended facial recognition sales to police, smaller players fill void
value.excerpt: Dozens of smaller facial recognition companies have taken over for Amazon, IBM and Microsoft in providing police departments with tools.

value.title: Host multiple TensorFlow computer vision models using Amazon SageMaker multi-model endpoints
value.excerpt: Amazon SageMaker helps data scientists and developers prepare, build, train, and deploy high-quality machine learning (ML) models quickly by bringing together a broad set of capabilities purpose-built for ML. value.title: Taipei-based computer vision startup eYs3D gets $7M Series A
value.excerpt: Ys3D Microelectronics, a fabless design house that focuses on end-to-end software and hardware systems for computer vision technology, has raised a $7 million Series A. Participants included ARM IoT Capital,

value.title: Computer Vision Is Like Investing In The Internet In The ‘90s
value.excerpt: I’m talking about computer vision. Computer vision is the kind of disruption that only comes around once a generation. Computers have long been able to count numbers and read text. But they could never master vision.

value.title: Facial recognition and biometric technology to end airport passport queues
value.excerpt: Queueing at passport controls could become a thing of the past under plans for fully automated border checks.Priti Patel, the home secretary, has published plans to install “contactless corridors”

value.title: Mayhill: Facial recognition technology used after Swansea disorder
value.excerpt: More arrests are due to be made this week and facial recognition will be used to trace others following violent disorder in Swansea, police have said. Seven arrests have already been made after cars were burnt out and windows smash.

value.title: Campaigners predict U.S. federal facial recognition regulation
value.excerpt: The indefinite moratorium by Amazon on sales of facial recognition to U.S law enforcement is adding to the sense of a vacuum for new federal legislation.

value.title: AppTek's Workbench Delivers 85% More Efficiency in Computer Vision and Speech Recognition Data Labeling Tasks
value.excerpt: Machine Learning (ML), Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), Neural Machine Translation (NMT), Text-to-Speech (TTS) and Natural Language Processing / Understanding (NLP/U) technologies, announced significant productivity gains through improvements to its Workbench Data Annotation and Labeling Platform.

value.title: We could see federal regulation on face recognition as early as next week
value.excerpt: On May 10, 40 advocacy groups sent an open letter demanding a permanent ban of the use of Amazon’s facial recognition software, Rekognition, by US police. The letter was addressed to Jeff Bezos and Andy Jassy,

value.excerpt: AInnovatoin has been recognized by Gartner as a 2021 Cool Vendor in its "Cool Vendors in AI for Computer Vision" report. The Gartner Cool Vendor report is "designed to highlight interesting, new and innovative vendors,

value.title: States move to limit government use of facial recognition software
value.excerpt: Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'The News with Shepard Smith' to discuss how different states are considering a full ban of facial recognition.

value.title: Amazon Halts Police's Use Of Facial Recognition Software: Reuters
value.excerpt: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) indefinitely extended the halt since June 2020 on the police use of its facial recognition software, Reuters reports. The nationwide backlash against police brutality towards non-Whites intensified by the murder of African-American George Floyd by a white policeman led to the initial halt.

value.title: Amazon extends ban of police using its facial recognition indefinitely
value.excerpt: Amazon Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) barred police from using its facial-recognition software almost a year ago, saying it would prohibit them from using it for a year. Now the online retailer says it will extend the ban "until further notice.

value.title: Build Your Own Selfie Drone With Computer Vision

value.title: Amazon again denies police use of facial recognition software Rekognition

value.title: Sequitur Labs Joins Edge AI and Vision Alliance
value.excerpt: Sequitur Labs today announced that it has joined the Edge AI and Vision Alliance, a global community of technology providers, leaders and startups dedicated to advancement in AI-powered computer vision and edge technologies.

value.title: New deep learning model brings image segmentation to edge devices
value.excerpt: AttendSeg is a new neural network architecture from DarwinAI designed to perform image segmentation on low-power/capacity computing devices.

value.title: MIT Researchers Commercializing RFID and Computer Vision Robotics
value.excerpt: Researchers at the MIT Media Lab are employing radio frequency identification technology along with computer vision to enable robots to explore their environment in order to locate and move a targeted item that may not be visible.

value.title: Google Photos vs Amazon Photos: which cloud storage giant is the best?

value.title: French scientists in Zimbabwe use facial recognition technology to ID giraffes

value.title: POLITICO AI: Decoded: AI.gov — US states move to ban facial recognition — AI and structural racism
value.excerpt: How global thinking on AI is shaping the world, from Berlin, Brussels, London and beyond. POLITICO’s AI correspondent cuts through the noise, introduces you to the key decision-makers you’ve never heard of and tells you what those in power don’t want you to know.

value.title: Understanding the differences between biological and computer vision
value.excerpt: Biological and Computer Vision by Gabriel Kreiman explains how AI attempts to replicate how humans and animals process visual data.

value.title: Funny faces in face recognition could increase phone security with new technology
value.excerpt: But experts said the best way to keep your phone safe using facial recognition technology is by putting on a funny face. “We’ve been able to actually take a regular picture of ourselves and fool the system,

value.title: IBM's CEO says it's leaving consumer AI like facial recognition to other companies, as it doubles down on pitching Watson to businesses
value.excerpt: Dialing back its consumer AI ambitions, CEO Arvind Krishna said IBM is solely focused on business use cases like automating IT and customer service.

value.title: Your face, voice, and fingerprints could defend you against banking scams
value.excerpt: Daphné Leprince-Ringuet tells Karen Roby that HSBC says that it prevented hundreds of millions of dollars from falling prey to hackers, simply thanks to voice recognition technology. Read more:

value.title: Amazon Facing Calls From Civil Rights Groups To Permanently Ban Police Use Of Facial Recognition As Deadline Approaches
value.excerpt: Amazon has yet to announce whether it will lift a one-year moratorium on the sale of its Rekognition product to police departments.
